p:
The scarcity of studies on yellow fever-induced renal tissue damage can be associated with the non-viral replication in kidney tissues
42 . Moreover, several cases have shown a variety of histological findings related to kidney damage, such as interstitial nephritis, tubular necrosis, interlobular thrombosis in kidney vessels, hemorrhage and adrenal gland ischemic necrosis
21 , 30 , 36 , 42 .
